definition[0]: if a shop or building closes up or is closed up, it stops being open to the public for a period of time
example[0]: The resorts are all closed up for the season.
definition[1]: to stop doing something for a period of time or permanently
example[1]: When it rains, there is no alternative but to close up shop.
definition[2]: if a group of people close up, they move closer together
definition[3]: if a wound closes up or if someone closes it up, the edges grow together again or are sewn together
example[2]: The scar is closing up nicely – it’ll soon be time to take the stitches out.
definition[4]: to become narrower or to shut
example[3]: The flowers close up at night.
example[4]: Occasionally the channel widened then closed up tight again.
definition[5]: to refuse to talk to someone about something
example[5]: The moment I said I was a police officer, everyone would close up like a clam.
definition[6]: a photograph or part of a film in which the camera seems to have been very close to the picture it took
example[7]: Much of the movie is shot in close-up.
